data.title: The 8 Best Movies & TV Shows Coming To Netflix This August—We Can't Wait To Watch!
data.meta_description: Find out which movies & TV shows you should add to your watch list this August on SheFinds.com
data.text:
Summer isn’t over yet, so if you haven’t hosted a movie marathon or snuggled up on the couch during a thunderstorm yet, you still have time! And luckily, Netflix just added a ton of new movies and TV shows to their platform, so you have even more to choose from. Keep reading for a list of the 8 best movies and TV shows coming to Netflix this month.

Netflix

1. A Good Girl's Guide to Murder (2023)

First up is A Good Girl's Guide to Murder. This TV series follows Pippa Fitz-Amobi, a high school senior with a passion for true crime who becomes entangled in a local mystery when she investigates a decades-old murder case that was supposedly solved. As Pippa delves deeper, she uncovers shocking secrets and faces increasing danger, all while trying to uncover the truth and bring justice to those involved. With its blend of suspense, drama, and intriguing twists, the series keeps viewers on the edge of their seats as Pippa navigates her investigation and the complexities of her own life.

Universal Pictures

2. The Cat in the Hat (2003)

In Dr. Seuss's The Cat in the Hat, Mike Myers brings to life the mischievous Cat who shows up unexpectedly at the home of two bored siblings, Conrad and Sally. With a flair for chaos and a penchant for fun, the Cat, along with his troublesome companions, Thing 1 and Thing 2, turns the siblings' dull day into a whirlwind of misadventures. The film combines slapstick humor and zany antics with a colorful, chaotic atmosphere, staying true to the spirit of Dr. Seuss’s beloved classic. Amidst the mayhem, the Cat’s antics offer a reminder about the value of imagination and the importance of responsibility. If your favorite Christmas movie is the live action Grinch, you'll love this one!

Columbia Pictures

3. Fury (2014)

In Fury, Brad Pitt leads a gritty ensemble cast as Sergeant Don “Wardaddy” Collier, commanding a Sherman tank and its crew during the final days of World War II. Set in 1945, the film follows the tank crew as they navigate the brutal realities of war while pushing deep into enemy territory. With intense combat scenes and a focus on camaraderie and survival, Fury delivers a raw and unflinching look at the sacrifices and challenges faced by soldiers in one of history’s most harrowing conflicts. The movie combines visceral action with character-driven drama, offering a powerful portrayal of wartime bravery and brotherhood. If you're a fan of World War II movies, this one will be right up your alley.

Columbia Pictures

4. White Chicks (2004)

White Chicks is a hilarious film starring Shawn Wayans and Marlon Wayans as FBI agents who go undercover as high-society women after a failed operation leaves two wealthy socialites in need of protection. Disguised in elaborate makeup and high fashion, the agents navigate the glamorous world of elite society, trying to maintain their cover while solving the case. From shopping sprees to dance battles and date nights to slumber parties, watching the pair navigate girlhood is nothing short of comedic gold.

Universal Pictures

5. The Lorax (2012)

In Dr. Seuss's The Lorax, a young boy named Ted embarks on a journey to discover the truth about the mysterious Lorax, a whimsical guardian of the forest, in hopes of winning the affection of his crush. Set in a vibrant, fantastical world where nature is under threat from industrial greed, this animated film blends humor with environmental advocacy as the Lorax, voiced by Danny DeVito, tries to protect the last tree. With colorful animation and a heartwarming story, the movie emphasizes the importance of caring for our planet and the impact of individual actions on the environment. A fun movie for the whole family, The Lorax is a classic movie you don't want to miss.

Paramount Pictures

6. World War Z (2013)

Another Brad Pitt classic! In World War Z, Brad Pitt stars as Gerry Lane, a former United Nations investigator thrust into a global crisis when a sudden and terrifying zombie apocalypse erupts. As societies collapse and governments crumble, Lane is tasked with finding the source of the outbreak and a potential solution, embarking on a high-stakes journey across various countries. The film combines intense action with a gripping narrative, showcasing large-scale, apocalyptic chaos and the struggle for survival. World War Z delivers a suspenseful and thrilling experience as it explores the global ramifications of a fast-moving zombie pandemic.

Netflix

7. Love Is Blind: UK (2024)

The crossover between reality TV and dating shows is hotter than ever right now, and one of the most popular shows is Love is Blind. This show explores the unconventional approach to finding love through emotional connections rather than physical appearances. Contestants date and form relationships while separated in “pods” where they can’t see each other, communicating solely through conversation. As they get to know each other on a deeper level, they decide if they want to propose and meet face-to-face. The UK edition of the show will be arriving on Netflix on August 7th.

Universal Pictures

8. Night School (2018)
